newsitem.title: JAPAN: Aramco term naphtha to be bid by April 4 - traders.
newsitem.headline: Aramco term naphtha to be bid by April 4 - traders.

text.p: Saudi Arabia's state-owned oil firm Saudi Aramco asked Asian naphtha buyers to submit their bids for term cargoes for the second half of 1997 by April 4, traders here and in South Korea said on Tuesday.
Bids will be valid until May 21, they said.
Although Aramco has not specified when and where face-to-face negotiations will take place, traders said talks are likely to be held in Singapore.

The term price for A-180, paraffinic naphtha favoured among petrochemical end-users, was set at $3.40 per tonne over the Aramco formula for the second half of 1996 and at the formula plus $6.50 for the first half of 1997.
In view of bullish sentiment toward naphtha in Asia, Saudi Aramco is expected to aim at a double-digit premium, traders said.
Asian firms import about 4.5 million tonnes of term naphtha per year from Saudi Arabia, they added.
